Description: Body fragment of East Greek pottery oinochoe or amphora. Glaze fired orange. Inside reserved; exterior, cream slip: key maeander frieze between bands at top; below, part of animal frieze - back of a grazing goat perhaps and pendant filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.658)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p. 4-5, pl. 3, 20) (photo upside down)
